chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Y: Type
P: Y -> Prop
lx: list X
ly: list Y

Goal:
Forall2 (fun (_ : X) (y : Y) => P y) lx ly <-> Forall P ly /\ length lx = length ly

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Forall2 : forall A B : Type, (A -> B -> Prop) -> list A -> list B -> Prop
Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
Forall2_conj : forall (X Y : Type) (R S : X -> Y -> Prop) (ll : list X) (mm : list Y), Forall2 (fun (x : X) (y : Y) => R x y /\ S x y) ll mm < -> Forall2 R ll mm /\ Forall2 S ll mm
Forall2_map_left : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R : Y -> X -> Prop) (f : Z -> Y) (ll : list Z) (mm : list X), Forall2 R (map f ll) mm < -> Forall2 (fun (x : Z) (y : X) => R (f x) y) ll mm
Forall2_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (x : X) (l : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: m) < -> R x y /\ Forall2 R l m
Forall2_map_right : forall (X Y Z : Type) (R : Y -> X -> Prop) (f : Z -> X) (mm : list Y) (ll : list Z), Forall2 R mm (map f ll) < -> Forall2 (fun (y : Y) (x : Z) => R y (f x)) mm ll
Forall_map : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (P : Y -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall P (map f ll) < -> Forall (fun x : X => P (f x)) ll
Forall2_map_both : forall (X Y X' Y' : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (f : X' -> X) (g : Y' -> Y) (ll : list X') (mm : list Y'), Forall2 R (map f ll) (map g mm) < -> Forall2 (fun (x : X') (y : Y') => R (f x) (g y)) ll mm
Forall2_impl : forall (X Y : Type) (R S : X -> Y -> Prop), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> S x y) -> forall (l : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R l m -> Forall2 S l m
Forall2_mono : forall (X Y : Type) (R S : X -> Y -> Prop), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), R x y -> S x y) -> forall (l : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R l m -> Forall2 S l m
Forall2_length : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R l m -> length l = length m
Forall2_cons_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (b : Y) (ll : list X) (mm : list Y), Forall2 R ll (b :: mm) -> {a : X & {ll' : list X | R a b /\ ll = a :: ll' /\ Forall2 R ll' mm}}
Forall_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) (ll : list X), Forall P (x :: ll) < -> P x /\ Forall P ll
Forall2_cons_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (a : X) (ll : list X) (mm : list Y), Forall2 R (a :: ll) mm -> {b : Y & {mm' : list Y | R a b /\ mm = b :: mm' /\ Forall2 R ll mm'}}
Forall2_app_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list X) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (l1 ++ l2) m -> {m1 : list Y & {m2 : list Y | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ m = m1 ++ m2}}
Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l
Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l
Forall2_app_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (l : list X) (m1 m2 : list Y), Forall2 R l (m1 ++ m2) -> {l1 : list X & {l2 : list X | Forall2 R l1 m1 /\ Forall2 R l2 m2 /\ l = l1 ++ l2}}
Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Exists P l
List.Forall_app : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), Forall P (l1 ++ l2) < -> Forall P l1 /\ Forall P l2
Forall_app : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (ll mm : list X), Forall P (ll ++ mm) < -> Forall P ll /\ Forall P mm
Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l
Forall2_ind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
Forall2_sind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> SProp), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
combine_nth : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (n : nat) (x : A) (y : B), length l = length l' -> nth n (combine l l') (x, y) = (nth n l x, nth n l' y)
Forall_nth : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall (i : nat) (d : A), i < length l -> P (nth i l d))
Forall_fold_right : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> fold_right (fun x : A => and (P x)) True l
Forall_forall_map : forall (X : Type) (f : nat -> X) (n : nat) (l : list X) (P : X -> Prop), l = map f (list_an 0 n) -> (forall i : nat, i < n -> P (f i)) < -> Forall P l
Exists_nth : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Exists P l < -> (exists (i : nat) (d : A), i < length l /\ P (nth i l d))
list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}}
Permutation_Forall2 : forall (A B : Type) (P : A -> B -> Prop) (l1 l1' : list A) (l2 : list B), l1 ~p l1' -> Forall2 P l1 l2 -> exists l2' : list B, l2 ~p l2' /\ Forall2 P l1' l2'
fold_left_length : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), fold_left (fun (x : nat) (_ : A) => S x) l 0 = length l
